name: Joseph
description: Dreamer sold by brothers, rose to rule Egypt. Coat of many colors, interpreter of dreams, saved his family and Egypt from famine. From pit to palace. 'You intended evil against me, but God intended it for good.'

dreaming-sheaves.name: The Dream of Sheaves
dreaming-sheaves.description: Young Joseph dreaming of sheaves bowing
dreaming-sheaves.prompt: young man sleeping with dream vision above - sheaves of wheat visible, his sheaf standing upright while brothers' sheaves bow down. 'Behold, your sheaves gathered around it and bowed down to my sheaf.' The dream that fueled their hatred.

coat-of-colors.name: Wearing the Coat
coat-of-colors.description: Young Joseph in his colorful coat
coat-of-colors.prompt: young man wearing beautiful multi-colored coat (ketonet passim) - proud but innocent, radiant in his father's gift. Unaware of brothers' jealousy growing in background. The dreamer in his glory, before the pit.

stripped-of-coat.name: Stripped of the Coat
stripped-of-coat.prompt: young man having his colorful coat torn from him - brothers' hands grasping, his face showing shock and betrayal. The visible symbol of favor being violently removed. 'They stripped Joseph of his coat.'

in-the-pit.name: In the Pit
in-the-pit.description: Joseph thrown into the empty cistern
in-the-pit.prompt: young man at bottom of dry cistern looking up - hands reaching toward the light above where brothers' faces peer down. 'They took him and threw him into the pit.' The dreamer cast down, awaiting his fate.

sold-to-ishmaelites.name: Sold to the Caravan
sold-to-ishmaelites.description: Joseph being sold to Ishmaelite traders
sold-to-ishmaelites.prompt: young man being led away by merchants - hands perhaps bound, looking back at brothers. Camels and caravan visible. 'They sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver.' The brother becoming merchandise.

resisting-temptation.name: Fleeing Temptation
resisting-temptation.prompt: turning away or running from reaching hands - leaving garment behind, choosing prison over sin. 'How can I do this great wickedness and sin against God?' Integrity that cost him but defined him.

in-prison.name: In the Prison
in-prison.description: Joseph in Egyptian prison, interpreting dreams
in-prison.prompt: in prison cell with other prisoners - perhaps interpreting butler's or baker's dream. Still using his gift even in the dungeon. 'Do not interpretations belong to God? Tell me your dreams.'

interpreting-pharaoh.name: Before Pharaoh
interpreting-pharaoh.prompt: standing before Pharaoh explaining dreams - gesturing as he interprets, confident bearing. Prisoner becoming advisor. 'Seven years of plenty and seven years of famine.' The moment everything changed.

ruling-egypt.name: Second in Command
ruling-egypt.prompt: standing in Egyptian royal garments and gold chain - signet ring, second only to Pharaoh. The slave who became ruler, overseeing grain distribution. 'Only in the throne will I be greater than you.'

testing-brothers.name: Testing the Brothers
testing-brothers.description: Joseph testing his brothers in Egypt
testing-brothers.prompt: as Egyptian vizier, face stern, questioning the brothers who don't recognize him - 'You are spies!' Testing whether they've changed, whether they'll protect Benjamin as they didn't protect him. The silver cup test coming.

revealing-identity.name: I Am Joseph
revealing-identity.description: The dramatic reveal to his brothers
revealing-identity.prompt: standing with arms open in emotional revelation - 'I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?' Tears streaming, brothers shocked and terrified before him. The moment of truth after years of hidden testing.

forgiving-brothers.name: Forgiving His Brothers
forgiving-brothers.prompt: embracing weeping brothers - 'You intended evil against me, but God intended it for good.' Forgiving those who tried to destroy him. Weeping on Benjamin's neck, then on all his brothers.

reuniting-with-jacob.name: Reuniting with Father
reuniting-with-jacob.description: Joseph meeting Jacob after years of separation
reuniting-with-jacob.prompt: embracing elderly Jacob in Egypt - both weeping, years of separation dissolved. 'Israel said to Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen your face and know that you are still alive.' The dreamer returning to his father.

rivalry-in-coat.name: Rivalry: In the Coat
rivalry-in-coat.description: Joseph wearing the coat, brothers watching
rivalry-in-coat.prompt: Young Joseph wearing the magnificent coat of many colors, standing proud. His face shows innocent confidence, perhaps describing a dream. The beloved son, not yet aware of the danger. In background or nearby, brothers (especially Judah) watching with dark expressions.

rivalry-in-pit.name: Rivalry: In the Pit
rivalry-in-pit.description: Joseph in the pit, Judah deciding his fate
rivalry-in-pit.prompt: Joseph in the pit, looking up at his brothers above. His coat stripped away, vulnerable and betrayed. Hands reaching up, pleading. The dreamer cast down. Above, Judah and brothers deciding — 'What profit if we kill him? Let us sell him.'

rivalry-as-vizier.name: Rivalry: As Vizier Revealed
rivalry-as-vizier.description: Joseph revealing himself to the brothers
rivalry-as-vizier.prompt: Joseph as Egyptian vizier, royal garments and jewelry, revealing his identity. Tears streaming down his face, arms perhaps outstretched. 'I am Joseph your brother, whom you sold into Egypt.' Judah and brothers cowering or frozen in shock before him.

rivalry-forgiving-judah.name: Rivalry: Forgiving Judah
rivalry-forgiving-judah.prompt: Joseph embracing Judah, the brother who suggested selling him but then offered himself for Benjamin. Both weeping. The transformation complete — Judah proved himself, Joseph forgives. 'God meant it for good.' Full circle from sale to embrace.
